title: CAIR Cancels 'Islamophobia' Event After Islamic Mass Murder in Florida
title_page: CAIR Cancels 'Islamophobia' Event After Islamic Mass Murder in Florida | Breitbart
text:
Islamic advocates cancelled a Tuesday press conference about “Islamophobia,” amid public distress and anger following Sunday’s mass murder of 49 unarmed Americans by a Muslim in Orlando, Fla.
The Tuesday “Islamophobia” press conference was scheduled by the Council on American-Islamic Relations, which has generated “ample evidence to establish the associations of CAIR… with [the Jew-hating jihad group] Hamas,” according to a 2009 statement by a federal judge.
“A forthright discussion about all forms of bias is vital to our nation,” said a spokesman for the group as they cancelled the “Islamophobia” event, which was scheduled for six-and-a-half months after the December 2015 Islamic massacre in San Bernardino, California. “However, it is our belief that in the wake of this weekend’s tragedy in Orlando, our nation should focus on addressing anti-LGBT hate,” he claimed.
The CAIR event was supposed to smear American groups who argue that officials are paying too little attention to the many Islamic scriptures that urge ordinary Islamic believers to attack non-Muslim civilians, such as the Americans in the gay nightclub in Orlando, Fla. The smear is included in the term “Islamophobia,” which says that normal fear or disgust over Islam’s violent teachings is a mental disease, or a “phobia” that is best cured.
However, the political term has been very successful.
It has been embraced by progressives to help persuade themselves that immigrant Muslims are powerless victims of conservative hatred — supposedly similar to American gays and lesbians — and to help them ignore the aggressive demands in orthodox Islam for a totalitarian, brutal, anti-liberal, apartheid-like theocracy. For example, The Huffington Post published at least 10 articles citing the smear in the two days after the Muslim massacre.
Unsurprisingly, CAIR aggressively goes after reporters who read Islamic scripture and who challenge CAIR’s “Islamophobia” claims.
Breitbart has frequently noted that the CAIR group is so closely entwined with Islamists and with jihadis that court documents and news reports show that at least five of its people — either board members, employees or former employees — have been jailed or repatriated for various financial and terror-related offenses.
Breitbart has also published evidence highlighted by critics showing that CAIR was named an unindicted co-conspirator in a Texas-based criminal effort to deliver $12 million to the Jew-hating HAMAS jihad group, that CAIR was founded with $490,000 from HAMAS, and that the FBI bans top-level meetings with CAIR officials. “The FBI policy restricting a formal relationship with CAIR remains … [but] does not preclude communication regarding investigative activity or allegations of civil rights violations,” said an Oct. 2015 email from FBI spokesman Christopher Allen.
On June 12, CAIR ejected a Breitbart reporter before the start of planned press conference on the group’s response to the massacre at the Pulse nightclub. The Breitbart reporter had planned to ask CAIR officials what steps Islamic groups are taking to distance American Muslims from orthodox Islamic scripture which frequently and clearly urge the expulsion, humiliation and the murder of homosexuals.
